    CV

    Education

    • B.S. - Molecular, Cell and Developmental Biology, University of California, Los Angeles, 2013
    • Ph.D. - Structural Biology, Stanford University, 2019

    Research Experience

    • Summer 2010: Undergraduate Research Assistant
      • National University of Singapore
      • qPCR analysis of differentially expressed cancer genes following HepB infection
    • Summer 2011: Undergraduate Research Assistant
      • Shimon Weiss/Feng Guo Labs, UCLA
      • Used a fluorescence based assay to measure activity of Drosha/DGCR8 complex in microRNA processing
    • Fall 2011 - Spring 2013: Undergraduate Researcher
      • Pascal Egea Lab, UCLA
      • Expression, purification and crystallization of ClpB and ClpS N-terminal domains from Plasmodium falciparum
      • Structures provided insights into the mechanism of substrate recognition and discrimination
    • Summer 2012: Amgen Scholar
      • Lab of Andre Hoelz, Caltech
      • Expression, purification and crystallization of the large nucleoporin Nup192, a component of the nuclear pore complex
    • Fall 2013 - Spring 2019: Graduate Student
      • Lab of Brian Kobilka, Stanford University
      • Structural basis of activation and signaling in GPCRS:
        • Structure of the μ opioid receptor in complex with the G protein Gi
        • Structural basis of activation of the family C GPCR, mGlu5
    • Spring 2019 - Fall 2019: Postdoctoral Fellow
      • Lab of Brian Kobilka, Stanford University
      • Structural basis of activation and signaling in GPCRS:
    • Spring 2020 - Present: Miller Fellow
      • Hosted by Yun S. Song, UC Berkeley
      • Using machine learning to create better models of the sequence/structure/function relationship in proteins

    Publications

    • Structural mapping of the ClpB ATPases of Plasmodium falciparum: Targeting protein folding and secretion for antimalarial drug design
      AhYoung AP, Koehl A, Cascio D, Egea PF
      Protein Science, 2015

    • Capture and X-ray diffraction studies of protein microcrystals in a microfluidic trap array
      Lyubimov AR, Murray TD, Koehl A, Araci IE, Uervirojnangkoorn M, Zeldin OB, Cohen AE, Soltis SM, Baxter EL, Brester AS, Sauter NK, Brunger AT, Berger JM
      Acta Crystallographica Section D Biological Crystallography, 2015

    • Structure of a putative ClpS N-end rule adaptor protein from the malaria pathogen Plasmodium falciparum
      AhYoung AP, Koehl A, Vizcarra CL, Cascio D, Egea PF
      Protein Science, 2015

    • Crystal structure of the human σ1 receptor
      Schmidt HR, Zheng S, Gurpinar E, Koehl A, Manglik A, Kruse AC
      Nature, 2016

    • Structure of the μ-opioid receptor-Gi protein complex
      Koehl A, Hu H, Maeda S, Zhang Y, Qu Q, Paggi JM, Latorraca, NR, Hilger DH, Dawseon R, Matile H, Schertler GFX, Granier S, Weis WI, Dror RO, Manglik A, Skiniotis G, Kobilka BK
      Nature, 2018

    • Development of an antibody fragment that stabilizes GPCR/G-protein complexes
      Maeda S, Koehl A, Matile H, Hu H, Hilger DH, Schertler GFX, Manglik A, Skiniotis G, Dawson RJP, Kobilka BK
      Nature Communications, 2018

    • Structural insights into the activation of metabotropic glutamate receptors
      Koehl A, Hu H, Feng D, Sun B, Zhang Y, Robertson MJ, Chu M, Kobilka TS, Laeremans T, Steyaert J, Tarrasch J, Dutta S, Fonseca R, Weis WI, Mathiesen JM, Skiniotis G, Kobilka BK
      Nature, 2019

    • A CLC-ec1 mutant reveals global conformational change and suggests a unifying mechanism for the CLC Cl–/H+ transport cycle
      Chavan TS, Cheng RC, Jiang T, Mathews II, Stein RA, Koehl A, Mchaourab HS, Tajkhoshid E, Maduke M
      Elife, 2020

    • The Impact of Protein Dynamics on Residue-Residue Coevolution and Contact Prediction
      Fung A, Koehl A, Jagota M, Song YS
      Biorxiv, 2022

    • Cross-protein transfer learning substantially improves zero-shot prediction of disease variant effects
      Jagota M, Ye C, Rastogi R, Albors C, Koehl A, Ioannidis N, Song YS
      Biorxiv, 2022

    • Transferability of Geometric Patterns from Protein Self-Interactions to Protein-Ligand Interactions
      Koehl A, Jagota M, Erdmann-Pham DD, Fung AF, Song YS
      Pacific Symposium on Biocomputing 2022, 2022

    • Functional genomics of OCTN2 variants informs protein-specific variant effect predictor for Carnitine Transporter Deficiency
      Koleske ML, McInnes G, Brown JEH, Thomas N, Hutchinson K, Chin MY, Koehl A, Arkin MR, Schlessinger A, Gallagher RC, Song YS, Altman RB, Giacomini KM
      Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America (PNAS), 2022
